page.title: 01GENERAL REVIEW OF BLOCK
page.content: Rottingdean and Saltdean are situated along the southern coastal edge of the block with Ovingdean to the northwest of Rottingdean. In the far northwest the southern part of Woodingdean comes into the block. These communities form roughly half of the block, the remainder being downland. Some downland is farmland used for crops and animal husbandry, but much is open downland with wooded areas. There is also an area of Common Land at Telscombe Tye to the east. There are good local shopping, hotel and entertainment facilities attractive views for walkers and, nearby, all the amenities of Brighton.
